TopicTitle: KSP 1.0.1 now allows emergency water landings?

Articles.Content:
While taking the stock D45 Stearwing on a joyride I ran out of fuel so I turned around and tried to glide towards the island runway.

Obviously I failed. So I decided to do an emergency landing in the ocean. I tried my best, used RCS to stabilize the plane but didnÃ‚Â´t have high hopes that Jeb and Val would survive.

I did hit the water with a speed of 35-40m/s and the nose maybe 2Ã‚Â° below the horizon on the Navball, landing gear out.

A huge splash, explosions, the plane ripped in half but the crew lives to crash once more. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

![rNmeuNL.png](http://i.imgur.com/rNmeuNL.png)

So was the physics of the water changed or have I just been lucky?
Just lucky, I guess. I haven't seen any physics changes in the changelog since this isn't really Squad's thing.

> 
> I did hit the water with a speed of 35-40m/s and the nose maybe 2Ã‚Â° below the horizon on the Navball, landing gear out.
> 
> A huge splash, explosions, the plane ripped in half but the crew lives to crash once more. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

The cockpit has an impact tolerance of 45m/s... that's why they're still alive.

.....Or perhaps they flew on the wings of love?

I admit it's not a scientific hypothesis, but scientists should keep an open mind.
I had a kerbal survive a terminal velocity head-first fall into the ocean the other day after a failed launch and failed parachute deployment
Are you on 1.0.1? Because 1.0.2 did address an issue of parts overheating upon hitting water. I wonder if that might be what is helping your parts survive.
you were going to slow to destroy the cockpit as someone above said that cockpit can survive up to 45m/s.
I managed to put a plane down with half a wing....

I mistakenly eva'd bill while on a 75by75 orbit. He started to deorbit and all of his fuel couldn't save him from that. He did survive the whole reentry burn and I thought he'd at least go splat, but he bounced about 5m and promptly planted a flag saying he survived. 

I've now promoted him above jeb level, but its a shame that it was in sandbox and not in my career save. 

\*only one kerbal was mildly harmed in this making\*

Squad did say somewhere that the water had gotten some love, i think it might have been in the AMA they did before release?

-Sam
Yes, water is much nicer in this update. I actually depend on it to land my big ships now, as seen in my signature.
